result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton Lee White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 21CF1131 and any sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain employment and/or continue with education.
Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical provider.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea and sentencing hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:34 AM Defendant Clayton Lee White in court, in person, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Francis P Raff in person.  Alexander David Goulart appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.  Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads guilty to Counts 1 and 2; Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant waives right to pre sentence investigation.  Court orders on Count 1 - 1 year and 6 months Wisconsin State and Prison and 3 years Extended Supervision, Count 2 - 2 years Wisconsin State Prison and 3 years and 6 months Extended Supervision, concurrent with each other and with 21CF1131 and with any other sentence being served, DOC collect costs, any treatment deemed necessary, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical provider, maintain employment and/or continue with education, 37 days sentence credit.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge and Substance Abuse programs.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:03 PM Defendant Clayton Lee White in court by video in custody with attorney Francis P Raff by video.  Emmeline Lee appeared by video with legal intern Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $500 with conditions. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
